Package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.querymatcher

Class ScanQueryMatcher

java.lang.Object
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.querymatcher.ScanQueryMatcher
All Implemented Interfaces:
ShipperListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
CompactionScanQueryMatcher, UserScanQueryMatcher
@Private public abstract class ScanQueryMatcher extends Object implements ShipperListener
A query matcher that is specifically designed for the scan case.

    • checkDeleted

      protected final ScanQueryMatcher.MatchCode checkDeleted(DeleteTracker deletes, Cell cell)

    • match

      public abstract ScanQueryMatcher.MatchCode match(Cell cell) throws IOException
      Determines if the caller should do one of several things:
      • seek/skip to the next row (MatchCode.SEEK_NEXT_ROW)
      • seek/skip to the next column (MatchCode.SEEK_NEXT_COL)
      • include the current KeyValue (MatchCode.INCLUDE)
      • ignore the current KeyValue (MatchCode.SKIP)
      • got to the next row (MatchCode.DONE)
      Parameters:
      cell - KeyValue to check
      Returns:
      The match code instance.
      Throws:
      IOException - in case there is an internal consistency problem caused by a data corruption.

    • moreRowsMayExistAfter

      public abstract boolean moreRowsMayExistAfter(Cell cell)
      Returns:
      Returns false if we know there are no more rows to be scanned (We've reached the stopRow or we are scanning on row only because this Scan is for a Get, etc.

    • compareKeyForNextRow

      public int compareKeyForNextRow(Cell nextIndexed, Cell currentCell)
      Parameters:
      nextIndexed - the key of the next entry in the block index (if any)
      currentCell - The Cell we're using to calculate the seek key
      Returns:
      result of the compare between the indexed key and the key portion of the passed cell
